page.title: 13History of Eridge Area.
page.content: In Roman times almost everywhere was dense forest.There were hardly any clearings.Later the Normans came and divided the area into strips(Rapes).The Neville family owned all of this area as far as the coast.They have owned the area for about 900 years.The Nevilles lived in a castle in Eridge Park.In the grounds,there is a spring called Chalybeate Spring.Near the spring are some caves.One of them is a smuggler's cave.It has a circular hole in the roof where the smugglers dropped their contraband. All over Eridge Park,the Nevilles built gothic style cottages so the view from the Park was not marred by ugly buildings.Sham Farm has a gothic style wall to hide the farm from view.
